open_spaces_details.description: Part of Stoke Newington (East and West Reservoirs and New River) Metropolitan Open Land

description: Re-provision of a playing pitch with associated infrastructure and landscaping works
decision_conditions: <p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:10pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than three years after the date of this permission.</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-733db142-7fff-1772-0b06-a717481fa09d"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:10pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91(1) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).</span></p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:10pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Except where modified by the conditions attached to this planning permission, the development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the approved drawings and associated documents.&nbsp;</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-f2e447b8-7fff-902b-7059-4aa9ee077c7e"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:10pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved in the interests of good planning.</span></p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">No development shall take place until the final Construction and Environmental Management Plan (CEMP) has been submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development must be implemented using the approved details and subsequently, the approved details shall not be changed.&nbsp;</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-34154b35-7fff-fedc-d8b4-abc43df96d89"><br></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Reason: To ensure potential ecological disturbances are managed and minimised, and to ensure appropriate highway and transport management and measures are undertaken.&nbsp;</span></p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">The recommendations of the Preliminary Ecological Appraisal (Job No. 9435, rev 1.0 by Temple dated 8/3/24) submitted with this application shall be followed.&nbsp;</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-374c9a1d-7fff-5a61-cad6-c61680840ffb"><br></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Reason: To ensure potential ecological disturbances are managed and minimised.</span></p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Prior to the first use of the artificial grass pitch, a Management and Maintenance Scheme for the facility including management responsibilities, a maintenance schedule, measures to ensure the replacement of the Artificial Grass Pitch within a specified period and a mechanism for review shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority after consultation with Sport England. The measures set out in the approved scheme shall be complied with in full, with effect from commencement of use of the artificial grass pitch hereby approved.</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-b206d6c7-7fff-c476-f8d9-2068e3579567"><br></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Reason: To ensure that the artificial grass pitch is capable of being managed and maintained to deliver a facility which is fit for purpose, sustainable and to ensure sufficient benefit of the development to sport.</span></p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Certification that the Artificial Grass Pitch (AGP) has the FIFA Quality Standard accreditation or equivalent International Artificial Turf Standard (IATS) requirements.&nbsp;</span></p><p><b style="font-weight:normal;" id="docs-internal-guid-0ed5a143-7fff-44bb-8014-139e631a811d"><br></b></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Operation of the facility for sports use shall not occur until: (a) certification that the Artificial Grass Pitch hereby permitted has met FIFA&nbsp; Quality Concept for Football Turf – FIFA Quality or equivalent International Artificial Turf Standard (IMS) and (b) confirmation that the facility has been registered on the Football Association’s Register of Football Turf Pitches have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.</span></p><p><br></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Reason: To ensure the development is fit for purpose and sustainable, provides sporting benefits.</span></p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">The pitch shall only be open between the hours of 8am to 9pm and will be locked by the site management team between 9pm and 8am. The lighting at the facility will be turned off between 9pm and 8am.&nbsp;</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-b6865abc-7fff-9a7b-e404-c011237f28e3"><br></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Reason: To protect the amenity of nearby occupiers and reduce the potential for antisocial behaviour.&nbsp;</span></p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Prior to the installation of the pitch and first operation of the facility details of a scheme for the cleaning of boots/footwear (to minimise the spread of microplastics) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This shall be installed and maintained at the facility in perpetuity.&nbsp;</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-e861021f-7fff-00c3-b97d-cf5f2dccace5"><br></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Reason: To protect the surface of the facility and reduce the potential for negative biodiversity impacts in the locality.&nbsp;</span></p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Prior to the first use of the development for sport/leisure hereby permitted, full details of secure, accessible, on site bicycle storage (consisting of at least 8 spaces, utilising 4 Sheffield Stands) including location, layout, stand type and spacing, shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority. Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first use of the development for sport/leisure and shall thereafter be retained and maintained.</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-58afd37b-7fff-386a-dd31-8abec0f64117"><br></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">REASON: To ensure that adequate provision of bicycle spaces is made within the development in the interests of discouraging car use, relieving congestion in surrounding streets, safeguarding highway safety and improving highway conditions in general. </span></p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Prior to first operation of the facility for sporting use, a revised biodiversity net gain calculation and assessment shall be carried out and submitted in writing to the Local Planning Authority, and approved in writing, confirming that the site has a biodiversity net gain of at least 0.13 habitat units which represents a 10.82% biodiversity net gain for habitats.&nbsp;</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-44da4a94-7fff-dc38-ddf0-c7aa313da9f6"><br></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">REASON: To ensure the proposal is developed out as envisaged and achieves a biodiversity net gain.&nbsp;</span></p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">No development above ground level shall take place until details of the perimeter fencing, lighting, gates and locks have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority following consultation with Sport England and the Metropolitan Police.&nbsp;</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><b style="font-weight:normal;" id="docs-internal-guid-6ea508a3-7fff-5217-1fdb-c5cfa99e7f2b"><br></b></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Prior to first use of the pitch a scheme of signage detailing the rules of use/play, location of nearest Public Phone, Defibrillator, First-Aid Kit and Knife Saver Bleed Kit shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority following consultation with the Metropolitan Police.&nbsp;</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><b style="font-weight:normal;"><br></b></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">The development must be implemented using the approved details and subsequently, the approved details shall not be changed unless otherwise&nbsp; agreed with the Local Planning Authority in consultation with Sport England.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><br></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Reason: To ensure the perimeter fencing is fit for purpose for a sporting facility, appropriate in this location, and to minimise opportunities for antisocial behaviour</span></p>
